Package ra.db

Class DatabaseConnections

java.lang.Object
ra.db.DatabaseConnections
Direct Known Subclasses:
MockDatabaseConnections
public class DatabaseConnections
extends java.lang.Object
Provider multi connections to a single database, which connections are kept connected. Take connection is round-robin.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    DatabaseConnections()
    Create database connection.
    DatabaseConnections​(java.lang.String name)
    Create database connection.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()
    Close all database connection.
    void connect​(DatabaseParameters param, int count, java.util.concurrent.Callable<DatabaseConnection> connectionMode)
    Create Kept connections.
    void connectConcurrentConnection​(DatabaseParameters param, int count)
    Create the Connect Object are kept connected.
    void connectOriginalConnection​(DatabaseParameters param, int count)
    There is non lock when executes SQL, probable return error results when execute insert.
    DatabaseConnection getConnection​(int index)
    Returns database connection.
    java.lang.String getName()
    Returns connection alias of database.
    StatementExecutor getStatementExecutor​(int index)
    Returns SQL statement executer.
    StatementExecutor next()
    Take StatementExecutor by round-robin, It's practical when had multi connections.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns connection alias of database.
      Returns:
      name

    • connectConcurrentConnection

      public void connectConcurrentConnection​(DatabaseParameters param, int count)
      Create the Connect Object are kept connected. Connect Object are Thread-safe.
      Parameters:
      param - The parameters of database connect setting.
      count - Kept connections count by the same database.

    • connectOriginalConnection

      public void connectOriginalConnection​(DatabaseParameters param, int count)
      There is non lock when executes SQL, probable return error results when execute insert.
      Parameters:
      param - The parameters of database connect setting.
      count - Kept connections count by the same database.

    • connect

      public void connect​(DatabaseParameters param, int count, java.util.concurrent.Callable<DatabaseConnection> connectionMode) throws java.lang.Exception
      Create Kept connections.
      Parameters:
      param - The parameters of database connect setting.
      count - Kept connections count by the same database.
      connectionMode - Need to be used database connect Object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throwable any exception, Throw the ConnectException when connect fail.

    • next

      public StatementExecutor next()
      Take StatementExecutor by round-robin, It's practical when had multi connections.
      Returns:
      StatementExecutor

    • getStatementExecutor

      public StatementExecutor getStatementExecutor​(int index)
      Returns SQL statement executer.
      Parameters:
      index - index
      Returns:
      StatementExecutor

      public DatabaseConnection getConnection​(int index)
      Returns database connection.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      DatabaseConnection

    • close

      public void close()
      Close all database connection.
